data.title: Small mall
data.text:
The mall has mostly. budget type store which is great for your cross border shopping
Ross, JC Penney, and herbergers occupy most of our time at the mall

data.title: average/what could be expected
data.text: As many others posted, it could use more additional stores to fill in the empty spaces. At the same time, I came here from another small area where our mall (an hour away) was comparatively similar. The food court is decent, while also having a snack vendor or  two at various areas.

data.title: Frequent visitor syndrome
data.text: My wife and I live in a town only a third the size of Great Falls. And it's not got much around it to draw from. So we always enjoy hitting a few of the stores here when we visit. It's always clean, has a decent variety of stores for a not too large center, and is enclosed for Montana winters and summers.

data.title: Small mall with lots of empty spots
data.text:
The economy is tough and this mall seems to be feeling the pinch.  Not that it's very large to begin with but there are a lot of empty spots.

Lots of parking, a couple of good stores (JCP & Scheel's) but very few people there.

data.title: Very cool layout. Some good stores.
data.text: Stopped in for the first time. Neat layout. Has a few good stores and some I've never heard of before. Selection was ok. Problem is every store is playing different music and so is the common area. A lot of stores had perfume stands right at the entrance and all the different smells tried to over-power the others. Ventilation must not be the best. Was burning the eyes and nose. Got what I needed and left.

data.title: More to the mall than meets the eye
data.text: The mall is mostly underground, so it's a lot bigger than expected.  Good shopping for a small town.  Close to hotel and good eateries.

data.title: Just killing time in Montana
data.text: Nice mall but not many plus size options.  Clean and quiet.  It was okay and plenty of parking.  They had good customer service which is important to me.

data.title: Family visits
data.text: I like to walk through malls and this is a nice clean mall, if you want to visit a mall without the hoodlums and trouble, the. This is a nice mall to visist

data.title: Sufficient
data.text: Not exactly huge but definitely can meet your needs. The selection of stores is small but I found what I was after. Never saw the food court and wasn't looking so not sure there was one. There is a Starbucks in the outlying parking lot. I hit it on the way out.

data.title: Needs remodeling & new stores
data.text: Needs a bigger variety of stores to fill the vacant spots. A remodel would make it look more modern- new floors, brighter lights, etc.

data.title: Malls are a dying breed
data.text: The stores that are there are really good...Buckle, Herbergers, Victoria's Secret, Sheels. Unfortunately there are many empty storefronts.

data.title: A few decent stores/sales
data.text: The Holiday Village Mall is the largest mall in Great Falls.  It has a decent number of stores but not like larger centres in Phoenix/Vegas.  The mall has a weird layout so we drove the car around so that we didn't have to carry bags all over the mall.  It provided a few hours of shopping but not a great mall. Average at best.

data.title: Kind of odd, reviewing a mall
data.text:
Some good stores here, the set up is a little different, and the food court is small--but it has a cool pretzel place. (The Twisted Pretzel)

Our group we found some cool stuff at different stores--mostly clothes, but some cool pop-culture stuff in one store that blasted very heavy metal the whole time--so if you don't like that music, either stay out of that store or bring earplugs.
If you like it, then even better.

Lots of parking and not too big, with some variety.

data.title: Weird Mall but the stores aren't so bad
data.text:
This mall has the weirdest layout ever, and there's virtually no food court, but the stores that are there were sufficient when you keep in mind that Great Falls isn't all that big. I'm not saying there's no food court at all, but there's not much selection... there's a Greek place, Subway, a pretzel place, Orange Julius and I think maybe one other place. 

We're Canadians who were looking to do a bit of shopping on a long weekend, and we were able to conjure up enough shopping in the city to kill a day or so. There's no other mall in the city but there's a strip of stores not far from this mall, where there's an Old Navy, and some other stores.

data.title: Not bad for a small town mall
data.text: Hasn't quite become another casualty of the internet age. It's clear that there used to be many more shops to choose from but the ones that have made it are nice.

data.title: Not As Good As It Used To Be
data.text: This mall used to be better about a decade ago. Now, it seems as if it's starting to become a "dead mall" - a lot of the stores at the east end have been closed. I did find what I was looking for, though.

data.title: At least its a mall.
data.text: In Great Falls, there is not much malls so take the opportunity to visit here. You can find good deals at Ross Dress for Less, Big Lots, Rue 21 and JC Penney. Its not a large mall but at least you got one to go to. What I find weird is the way the mall is laid out from one end to the other. There is not a consistent way for wheel chair, strollers or scooters to travel from one end to another since there is techincally two levels here but it depends of where you are at. If you are on the Bed Bath and Beyond side, to get to the other side with mobility devices, you will need to go to the JC Penny and use their elevators to go downstairs to the food court so you can be at the mall level at the other side. The ramp leading you downwards towards Sheels has a set of stairs that will greet you and stop you in your tracks. Oh well, perhaps because its older mall.

data.title: Good place for shopping and eating
data.text: This mall has much better shopping than your average small town mall. The mall is very clean and the mall employees are very friendly. Good stores and good food, overall a nice experience.

data.title: Shopping...shopping...shopping!
data.text: This shopping mall was clean, well maintained and huge. It offers a variety of stores, for any age group, for any interests plus a food court for a quick meal. You can easily spends hours inside this mall so make sure you have very good walking shoes. Highly recommend this place to anyone. Across the mall is Café Rio Mexican restaurant - go there if you want to eat outside of the mall.

data.title: Voglia di shopping
data.text:
Abbiamo fatto un giro, ma a parte il negozio sportivo....il centro è poco frequentato e con negozi chiusi..

la crisi economica colpisce anche qui.
